fields.name: The Winston Theatre
fields.description:
The Winston Theatre, named after former Chancellor Winston Churchill, is the University of Bristol Students' Union's flagship venue, and the home of Bristol student theatre since 1965.

A traditional proscenium arch theatre with dressing rooms, flexible orchestra pit and apron stage, permanent cyclorama, winched lighting bars and versatile hemp bars. The theatre features 204 fixed saleable seats.

For technical specification please contact the Stage Technicians' Association

The theatre is sometimes available for private hire. See the Bristol SU Website for more information.

Accessibility

Two wheelchair spaces at rear of auditorium. Lift access to box office (1st Floor) and wheelchair spaces (2nd Floor). Building access via wheelchair ramp; one disabled parking space.

Assistance available from front-of-house staff. Please email tickets@uobtheatre.com in advance to let us know of any particular requirements which we will do our best to cater for.

fields.name: The Pegg Theatre
fields.description:
The Pegg Studio Theatre is a flexible black box studio space, sited on the first floor of the Students' Union. The 80 seater venue can host a wide variety of performances, from traditional setups to theatre in the round.

For technical specifications please contact the Stage Technicians' Association. The theatre is sometimes available for private hire - please contact the Bristol SU Events Team for more information.

fields.name: The Anson Rooms
fields.description:
The Anson Room, named after 18th Century Admiral George Anson, is a large multipurpose hall, used for touring gigs, special events and occasionally student performances

Features a large high stage, high ceiling, and adjoining bar. Seated capacity 500, standing 1150.

The Anson Room is available for private hire. See the Bristol SU Website for more information.

fields.name: Stage Technicians Association
fields.description:
A friendly, fun and FREE society for anyone who enjoys the "dark side" of theatre!

We design, rig and crew Union shows, so whether you're interested in stage management, lighting, sound or even carpentry; whether you have years' experience or none; we are the society for you! Find us always in the theatre...

Website: http://bristolsta.com

fields.name: Dramsoc
fields.description:
Bristol's largest and oldest performing arts society. Something for everyone interested in theatre: acting, directing, producing, writing, reviewing or watching. From "TRASH", eight 10-minute extracts back-to-back, to full length plays, in the Union, Bristol and beyond. Opportunities to go up to Edinburgh, participate in workshops and write plays.

Website: https://www.bristoldramasociety.co.uk/

Contact: bristoldramsoc@gmail.com

fields.name: Musical Theatre Bristol
fields.description:
Welcome to Music Theatre Bristol, a student theatre company from the University of Bristol! From cabarets to showcases, small-scale shows to full-scale musical productions, MTB is proud to be one of the most successful performing arts societies at the university.

  • f

  • fg

Website: http://www.musictheatrebristol.com

Contact: president@musictheatrebristol.com

fields.name: PantoSoc
fields.description:
Everyone is guaranteed a part! We perform several pantomimes a year, including our epic Christmas show and our Panto-in-a-day, all written by society members.

If you want to get involved in Bristol's friendliest society, whether it's on stage, backstage or enjoying crazy socials, then this is the place for you!

Website: http://www.pantosoc.co.uk/

Contact: president@pantosoc.co.uk

fields.name: Spotlights
fields.description:
Spotlights specialises in taking risks, finding challenges and discovering new talent. Whether you enjoy writing, directing, performing or the process of devising a piece of theatre, Spotlights is here to encourage, and make sure that you are able to create whatever the vision is that you have in your mind!

Contact: bristolspotlights@gmail.com

fields.name: BOpS
fields.description:
Bristol University Operatic Society provides many opportunities to get involved in the world of opera.

With full-scale productions in the Winston Theatre and a number of smaller events, we are always on the lookout for singers, instrumentalists, conductors and directors.directors.

Website: https://www.bristoluniversityoperaticsociety.com Contact: president.bops@gmail.com

fields.name: Dance Society
fields.description:
UoB Dance Society offers members a full weekly time-table of professionally-led dance classes for all interests and abilities. The society holds a massive annual dance show, additional to smaller performances and competition opportunities. UoB Dance Society enjoys an enthusiastic atmosphere encouraged by various socials arranged throughout the year.

Website: https://www.bristolsu.org.uk/groups/dance-society-1045 Contact: bristoldancesoc@gmail.com

fields.name: ImprovSoc
fields.description:
Improvsoc is for all those with an inventive bone in them!

We're all about improvisation; improvised comedy in particular - running workshops to help give you the skills, and putting on shows to give you the thrills. If you love comedy, drama or spontaneity, we're the society for you!

Website: http://www.bristolimprov.co.uk/

Contact: improvbristol@gmail.com

fields.name: A Cappella
fields.description:
University of Bristol A Cappella Society gives absolutely anyone who wants to sing the chance to get involved in any of our groups, which include both auditioned and unauditioned groups. Our groups put on and participate in several concerts a year, showcasing Bristol as one of the hottest spots for UK a cappella!

Website: http://www.uobacappella.org.uk/

Contact: contact@uobacappella.org.uk

fields.name: Revunions
fields.description:
The South-West's Comedy Crèche. We write, direct and perform our own sketch comedy. If you fancy getting involved, come along to our weekly workshops and join us in creating brand new sketches. We do lots of shows and every year take two up to the Edinburgh Festival Fringe. We also host many scratch nights, giving budding non-sketch comedians the chance to perform with us as well, so whatever kind of comedy you're into, there's loads of opportunity to get involved. Become a member with the Bristol Revunions to be kept up to date with all of this and more.

Twitter: @BrisRevunions

Website: http://www.bristolrevunions.com/

Contact: revunions@gmail.com

fields.name: Legally Blonde
fields.description:
Music Theatre Bristol are bending and snapping our way to the Winston Theatre this February with the first of our main shows: Legally Blonde!

Based on the 2001 film, Legally Blonde tells the story of Elle Woods – a sorority girl who follows love all the way to Harvard Law only to achieve more than anyone thought she was capable of! With only five performances be sure to get your tickets fast to avoid disappointment!

fields.name: Present Laughter
fields.description: Present Laughter

fields.name: Snow White: The Panto
fields.description:
Snow White is having a crisis. 18 and single, she's basically a spinster! Her mum, the Evil Queen, isn't helping things, and won't let Snow be with her one true love... the Mad Hatter! But is the Hatter all that he seems? (Oh no he isn't!) Can the Seven Dwarves save the day? And did somebody just invent Pokémon?? Let our narrators Sherlock and Watson tell you this hilarious tale, filled with songs (that are, not gonna lie, absolute bangers) and good times coming out of our ears.

Featuring classic fairytale characters like the Huntsman and Goldilocks, as well as not-so-classic ones from Game of Thrones to Adventure Time. How d'ya like them apples?

fields.description: Student ID required

fields.name: Society Member
fields.description: Must be a member of the performing society
